cities.name: Westfield
cities.schools: Westfield Public Schools earn an A+ from Niche and rank among New Jersey's top 20 districts.
cities.transportation: NJ Transit's Raritan Valley Line serves Westfield Station.
cities.commute: Typical commute: ride to Newark Penn and transfer to a Midtown Direct train, reaching NYC in about 50 minutes.

cities.name: Summit
cities.schools: Summit Public Schools consistently place within the state's top 20.
cities.transportation: Midtown Direct service on the Morris & Essex Line runs through Summit Station.
cities.commute: Residents board the M&E train for a 40-minute trip straight to NYC Penn Station.

cities.name: Elizabeth
cities.schools: Elizabeth's magnet academies such as Elizabeth High School rank within New Jersey's top 50.
cities.transportation: The Northeast Corridor Line and extensive NJ Transit buses serve the city.
cities.commute: Commuters take a direct Northeast Corridor train from Elizabeth Station to NYC Penn in about 30 minutes.

cities.name: Morristown
cities.schools: Morris School District holds an A rating, with Morristown High in the state's upper third.
cities.transportation: Midtown Direct trains on the Morris & Essex Line serve Morristown Station.
cities.commute: The ride to NYC Penn averages just under an hour.

cities.name: Madison
cities.schools: Madison Public Schools frequently rank in New Jersey's top 50.
cities.transportation: Madison Station sits on the Morris & Essex Midtown Direct line.
cities.commute: Trains reach NYC in approximately 55 minutes door to door.

cities.name: Chatham
cities.schools: The School District of the Chathams ranks top 10 statewide.
cities.transportation: Chatham Station is on the Morris & Essex Line with direct Midtown service.
cities.commute: Travelers reach NYC Penn in about 50 minutes.

cities.name: Montclair
cities.schools: Montclair Public Schools carry an A rating and renowned magnet system.
cities.transportation: Montclair-Boonton Line provides Midtown Direct rail from several local stations.
cities.commute: Rush-hour trains reach NYC Penn in roughly 40 minutes.

cities.name: Millburn
cities.schools: Millburn Township Schools often claim the #1 spot in New Jersey.
cities.transportation: Short Hills and Millburn stations sit on the Morris & Essex Midtown Direct line.
cities.commute: Direct trains arrive in NYC Penn in about 40 minutes.

cities.name: Newark
cities.schools: Newark's magnet programs like Science Park High rank among the state's best.
cities.transportation: NJ Transit, PATH, and Amtrak all converge at Newark Penn Station.
cities.commute: A PATH or NJ Transit train carries commuters to Manhattan in around 20 minutes.

cities.name: Jersey City
cities.schools: Jersey City schools include top-ranked McNair Academic High (Top 10 in NJ).
cities.transportation: Extensive PATH, light rail, and ferry options serve the city.
cities.commute: A PATH ride from Grove Street to World Trade Center takes about 15 minutes.

cities.name: Hoboken
cities.schools: Hoboken's district and charter schools earn B+ to A grades with rising test scores.
cities.transportation: Hoboken Terminal offers PATH, NJ Transit rail, and ferry service.
cities.commute: Most commuters take the PATH to midtown or lower Manhattan in roughly 15 minutes.

cities.name: Weehawken
cities.schools: Weehawken Township Schools receive A ratings in state comparisons.
cities.transportation: NJ Transit buses and NY Waterway ferries depart from Port Imperial.
cities.commute: Commuters reach midtown Manhattan in 10â€“20 minutes via bus or ferry.

cities.name: New Brunswick
cities.schools: New Brunswick's magnet schools, including Health Sciences, post strong statewide rankings.
cities.transportation: The Northeast Corridor Line and multiple bus routes serve the city.
cities.commute: Riders take a direct train to NYC Penn in about 50 minutes.

cities.name: Edison
cities.schools: Edison Township Public Schools earn an A rating and sit in the state's top 50.
cities.transportation: Edison and Metropark stations lie on the Northeast Corridor Line.
cities.commute: From Metropark, trains reach NYC Penn in roughly 45 minutes.

cities.name: Woodbridge
cities.schools: Woodbridge Township Schools maintain above-average scores across the district.
cities.transportation: Metropark and Woodbridge stations provide Northeast Corridor and North Jersey Coast Line access.
cities.commute: Commuters typically board at Metropark for a 40-minute ride to NYC Penn.
